feed.title: NewsTracker: nemtsov
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Two Russian opposition parties unite after Nemtsov killing
Two Russian opposition parties unite after Nemtsov killing
entry.summary:
Critics of President Vladimir Putin say he bears ultimate political responsibility for the gunning down of Nemtsov, a former deputy prime minister, on Feb. 27.

RPR-Parnas, co-founded by Nemtsov, and Party of Progress, led by anti-graft blogger Alexei Navalny, said they would also run together in local elections due in some regions this year.

entry.title: Chechen commander in Ukraine drawn into Russian intrigue
entry.summary: Osmayev said he has few doubts that the perpetrators of Nemtsov's killing have ties to Kadyrov, but that the security services now need a convenient scapegoat whose guilt would be easily acceptable to the Russian general public.

entry.title: Chechen commander in Ukraine drawn into Russian intrigue over Nemtsov murder investigation
entry.summary:
Adam Osmayev hailed Nemtsov as a "true hero" both for condemning Russia's war against separatists in Chechnya and for decrying Russian intervention in the current conflict in Ukraine.

Osmayev denies involvement and no evidence has been presented linking him to the hit on Nemtsov, who was a relentless critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Within days of Nemtsov's assassination, investigators arrested five Chechens, including a senior officer in Kadyrov's police force, and charged them with carrying out the killing.

entry.title: Video reports conflict in probe of Putin critic's slaying
entry.summary: TV Center, a station controlled by the Moscow city government, broadcast a poor-resolution video from a web camera that it said showed Nemtsov and Duritskaya shortly before he was killed.

entry.title: Suspect charged with killing Putin foe tells court he was beaten, pressured to confess
entry.summary: Many of Nemtsov's allies and colleagues are skeptical about the Chechen theory, arguing that Nemtsov's death in a tightly secured area near the Kremlin wouldn't have been possible without official involvement.

entry.title: Nemtsov Suspects Tells Court He Was Pressured to Confess
entry.summary: Dadaev's lawyer, Ivan Gerasimov, said after the hearing that his client didn't even know who Nemtsov was before he was arrested.

entry.title: Nemtsov suspects tells court he was pressured to confess
entry.summary: Five people have been detained in connection with Nemtsov's shooting on Feb. 27.

entry.title: Mother of 2 suspects in Nemtsov killing defends her sons
entry.summary: Anzor and Shagid Gubashev are among five men, all ethnic Chechens, accused in the shooting death of Nemtsov on a bridge near the Kremlin on Feb. 27.

entry.title: Mother of 2 suspects in Nemtsov killing defends her sons
Russian MPs refuse to hold minute's silence for murdered Nemtsov
Nemtsov murder suspect likely 'confessed under torture,' activist says
entry.summary: Aides to Nemtsov, a former deputy prime minister, suspect Russia's state security apparatus is complicit in the crime.

entry.title: Suspect in Nemtsov killing likely confessed 'under torture'
entry.summary: A court in Moscow heard the men were being probed under a section of the Russian criminal code relating to murders carried out for financial gain, in a sign investigators believe Mr Nemtsov's murder was a hit.

entry.title: Suspects in Nemtsov killing probably tortured: Russian rights activist
Boris Nemtsov: Claim Suspect Was Tortured
entry.summary: Mr Babushkin reported Dadayev as saying: "They shouted at me all the time, 'You killed Nemtsov, didn't you?'. I said, no."

entry.title: Chechnya?s leader vows loyalty to Putin amid Nemtsov probe
entry.summary:
Malashenko said he didn't believe that Nemtsov was targeted for his comments related to Charlie Hebdo because he was far less outspoken than others.

His view was shared by many other observers, who have remained skeptical about the official version, saying that while Nemtsov criticized the Charlie Hebdo attackers, he made no comments against Islam.

entry.title: Chechnya's leader vows loyalty to Putin amid Nemtsov probe
Russia: 2 Suspects Detained in Murder of Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary: Many believe that Nemtsov's death in a tightly secured area near the Kremlin wouldn't have been possible without official involvement, and could be an attempt to scare other government foes.

entry.title: Russia: 2 suspects detained in murder of Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary: One of Nemtsov's closest allies in the opposition, Ilya Yashin, said on Facebook that "It's hard to judge whether these are the real performers or if the investigation went down a false track."

entry.title: Russia: 2 suspects detained in murder of Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary: "We hope that they detained those who really are related to the murder, that it is not a mistake," Ilya Yashin, one of Nemtsov's closest allies in the opposition, told Interfax.

entry.title: 2 suspects detained in killing of Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary: He said they were "suspected of carrying out this crime," but it wasn't clear if either of the suspects was believed to have fired the shots that killed Nemtsov as he and a companion walked over a bridge near the Kremlin on Feb. 27.

entry.title: Two held over killing of Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary: Moscow: Two suspects have been detained in relation to the murder of Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov, the head of the Federal Security Service Alexander Bortnikov said.

entry.title: Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov wrote notes the day before he was shot dead
entry.summary: Now it has emerged that the day before his death, Mr Nemtsov and close aide Olga Shorina were discussing a sensitive investigation he was preparing into Moscow's backing for separatist fighters in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Sole witness in Nemtsovâ€™s slaying receives death threats
entry.summary:
Authorities in Ukraine say the sole witness in the killing in Moscow of prominent Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov has received death threats since returning to her family home in Ukraine.

The General Prosecutor's office in Kiev said in a statement Friday that Anna Duritskaya, the 23-year old model who was walking with Nemtsov at the time of his killing, is being provided with protection.

entry.title: Putin: Nemtsov's murder carried "political subtext"
entry.summary: Law enforcement officials have said one lead they were exploring was that the killing was linked to Nemtsov's personal life or business dealings.

entry.title: Russia's Putin calls Boris Nemtsov's murder political
entry.summary:
The Kremlin has denied any involvement, saying that the killing was a "provocation" designed to discredit Putin and strengthen his opponents, but Nemtsov's friends say the Kremlin is to blame for fomenting an atmosphere of hatred towards its opponents.

The vehicle drove past the spot where Nemtsov was shot after the killing and when police patrol cars had already arrived at the scene, the statement said.

entry.title: Putin says opposition politician Boris Nemtsov's murder is a 'disgrace' for Russia
entry.summary:
The Russian leader had sent his condolences to Nemtsov's mother, but his comments Wednesday were his first public remarks on the subject.

Nemtsov, 55, one of Putin's most vehement critics, was killed just hours after a radio interview in which he denounced the president for his "mad, aggressive" policies in Ukraine.

Opposition activist Ilya Yashin said police had seized computers and documents during searches in Nemtsov's apartment in Moscow and his office in Yaroslavl, where he worked as a regional lawmaker.

On his Facebook page, Yashin posted a picture of what he said was Nemtsov's handwritten note, saying he was contacted by paratroopers from a unit that lost 17 men but who were afraid to speak publicly on the issue.

entry.title: Russian security service chief says several suspects in Nemtsov case: report
entry.summary: "We must finally rid Russia of the disgrace and tragedy of the kinds of things we recently saw and experienced: I mean the audacious murder of Boris Nemtsov in the very centre of the capital."

entry.title: Russian security service chief says several suspects in Nemtsov case: agencies
Growing fear in Russia leaves opposition in despair after murder of Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Moscow: The murder of Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov was the last straw for Dmitry Ostashenko, who decided to give up his life as a logistics manager in Moscow and try to leave Russia with his wife.

"We can't live here any more," Mr Ostashenko, 31, an opposition activist like his wife, Inna Malashenko, said at the Sunday march to commemorate Mr Nemtsov, carrying a sign that said "I'm Not Afraid".

Zhanna, a daughter of murdered Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov, farewells her father in Moscow.

Candles glow as people gather for a memorial service before the funeral of slain opposition figure Boris Nemtsov in Moscow.

entry.title: Boris Nemtsov's funeral: Thousands of mourners gather in Moscow to view Putin critic's body
entry.summary: "They probably know that if they don't come, then at some point people will be coming for them," Irina Khakamada, co-leader of a liberal party in parliament with Mr Nemtsov, said of the Russian officials' presence.

entry.title: Kremlin critic wants international probe into Nemtsov death
entry.summary:
Vladimir Putin's spokesman has called the killing of Nemtsov last week a "provocation," and Russian authorities are investigating.

He said he wants to help in any investigation, because Nemtsov helped raise attention to the case of whistleblower lawyer Sergei Magnitsky.

entry.title: Boris Nemtsov case: Russian mourners view body of slain opposition leader
entry.summary: Nemtsov's killing was the biggest political assassination in Russia since 2006, when another Kremlin foe, journalist Anna Politkovskaya, was shot to death in the elevator of her Moscow apartment building on Putin's birthday.

entry.title: Russia bids farewell to slain Putin critic Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
A Russian woman holds orchids at the front of a line for the funeral of Boris Nemtsov.

"I had to come," said Arina Borodina, who works for Echo of Moscow radio, where Nemtsov gave his last interview hours before being shot dead within view of the Kremlin last Friday night.

Men place candles as they arrive at a farewell ceremony to slain opposition leader Boris Nemtsov in Moscow on Monday.

Like others in the queue, Ms Belova said she would have voted for Nemtsov had there been free elections, giving the lie to the oft-repeated view that there is simply no alternative to President Putin.

Nemtsov was a "golden boy" when the late President Boris Yeltsin promoted him from a regional governorship to the job of deputy prime minister and he was tipped as a possible heir to the sick and ageing Kremlin leader.

entry.title: Russia bids farewell to slain Putin critic Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
People line up to pay their last respects at the coffin of Boris Nemtsov inside the Sakharov centre in Moscow.

People gather to pay their last respects at the coffin of Boris Nemtsov during the farewell ceremony.

entry.title: Mourners pay respects to Russian opposition figure Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary: Many supporters suspect that the killing was ordered by the Kremlin in retaliation for Nemtsov's criticism of Putin, while authorities have suggested several possible motives, including a provocation aimed at tarnishing the Russian president's image.

entry.title: Mourners file past body of slain Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary: MOSCOW -- After paying their final tributes Tuesday to slain Kremlin critic Boris Nemtsov, many members of Russia's beleaguered opposition are looking into the future with gloom.

entry.title: Mourners view body of slain opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
The sadness and loss that drew thousands to Nemtsov's funeral is unlikely to add vigor to the small and marginalized opposition, or dent the broad public support for President Vladimir Putin.

Kremlin critics say the virulent nationalist propaganda on state television, which cast the 55-year-old Nemtsov and other liberals as Western stooges, helped prepare the ground for his killing on Friday night.

Putin dubbed Nemtsov's killing a "provocation," and nationwide TV networks quickly picked up the theme, blaming Western intelligence agencies, Ukrainian agents or even the opposition.

entry.title: Mourners view body of slain opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Mourners are lining up outside a Moscow human rights center for the funeral of murdered Nemtsov.

Thousands of mourners and dignitaries filed past Nemtsov's white-lined coffin, and many wept as they offered flowers.

Nemtsov had been a deputy prime minister under Russia's first elected president, Boris Yeltsin, who touted him as his likely successor before opting instead for Putin.

entry.title: Mourners view body of slain opposition leader Boris Nemtsov
Security cameras at Boris Nemtsov murder scene 'switched off'
entry.summary:
The Federal Guards Service, the agency responsible for Kremlin security, said none of its cameras had captured the crime because they faced inwards towards the Kremlin walls, not outwards to where Mr Nemtsov was shot.

Mr Nemtsov, 55, an opposition politician who had once been deputy prime minister, was murdered as he walked home from dinner with his 23-year-old Ukrainian girlfriend, Anna Duritskaya.

entry.title: Nemtsov's girlfriend didn't see killer
entry.summary:
Former British prime minister John Major was among the first to arrive at the Andrei Sakharov rights centre in central Moscow early on Tuesday, where Nemtsov's body lay in state.

Nemtsov was gunned down just before midnight on Friday while walking across a bridge just a short distance from the Kremlin with his Ukrainian model girlfriend Ganna Duritska.

entry.title: Nemtsov's girlfriend didn't see killer
entry.summary: Friends of Nemtsov said he had been working on a report containing what he described as proof of secret Russian military involvement in the bloody uprising by pro-Moscow militias in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Obama: Nemtsov killing 'sign of worsening climate in Russia'
entry.summary: The US president has called for a full investigation into the slaying of Nemtsov, a critic of President Vladimir Putin and a former deputy prime minister.

entry.title: Nemtsov?s shaken girlfriend says she didn?t see killer
entry.summary: Nemtsov, 55, was shot several times and killed instantly, becoming the most prominent opposition figure to be murdered during President Vladimir Putin's 15-year rule.

entry.title: Polish top senator: Russia banned me from Nemtsov's funeral
entry.summary:
In Brussels late Monday, a senior lawmaker in the European Parliament claimed that she too had been denied access to Russia as she traveled to attend Nemtsov's funeral.

Latvian lawmaker Sandra Kalniete, who is vice-chair of the biggest bloc in the EU assembly, said that all of Europe stands by Nemtsov's family, friends and Russian democrats "despite this decision of the Putin regime."

entry.title: Polish top senator: Russia banned me from Nemtsov's funeral
entry.summary:
Bogdan Borusewicz " Poland's leading opposition activist under communism " was to lead a delegation of Polish politicians and lawmakers attending Nemtsov's funeral Tuesday.

Nemtsov was shot dead Friday night near the Kremlin.

entry.title: Boris Nemtsov's shaken girlfriend says she didn't see killer
entry.summary: MOSCOW - Boris Nemtsov's girlfriend has broken her public silence on the murder of the Russian opposition activist, saying she did not see the killer who gunned him down as they strolled across a bridge near the Kremlin.

entry.title: Boris Nemtsov's shaken girlfriend says she didn't see killer
entry.summary: Nemtsov, an opposition politician whose murder has deepened a divide between liberals and Putin supporters, will be buried on Tuesday at the Troekurovskoye cemetery in western Moscow, far from where Russia's top politicians are usually buried.

entry.title: Nemtsov murder witness says she is blocked from leaving Russia
entry.summary:
Duritskaya said she waited on Friday evening in the Bosco cafe in the GUM department store on Red Square for Nemtsov to finish an interview on the Echo of Moscow radio station.

Nemtsov, a physicist turned politician, was separated from his wife and children, and his career had fallen precipitously from the days when he was seen as a successor to Boris Yeltsin to be leader of Russia.

entry.title: Nemtsov murder witness says she is blocked from leaving Russia
entry.summary:
Slain Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov's companion Anna Duritskaya tells a Russian TV station she is being held against her will by Russian investigators.

Boris Nemtsov was gunned down on Friday evening a he walked with Anna Duritskaya.

People march in memory of Russian opposition leader and former deputy prime minister Boris Nemtsov in central Moscow.

Model Anna Duritskaya was the one witness of the killing of Boris Nemtsov.

entry.title: Nemtsov's shaken girlfriend says she didn't see killer
entry.summary: The station, which superimposed its own time code on the footage, circled figures that it said were Nemtsov and the woman walking across the bridge on a rainy night.

entry.title: Russians March In Memory Of Murdered Opposition Leader Nemtsov
Russians march in memory of murdered Putin critic [Video]
entry.summary: They say they are pursuing several lines of inquiry, including the possibility that Nemtsov, a Jew, was killed by radical Islamists or that the opposition killed him to blacken Putin's name.

entry.title: Thousands march in Russia to mourn Putin critic Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
"It is a blow to Russia. If political views are punished this way, then this country simply has no future," Sergei Mitrokhin, an opposition leader, said of Nemtsov's murder.

Nemtsov was one of the leading lights of an opposition struggling to revive its fortunes three years after mass rallies against Putin failed to prevent him from returning to the presidency after four years as prime minister.

Putin has been Russia's dominant leader since 2000, when ailing President Boris Yeltsin chose the former KGB spy as his successor, a role Nemtsov had once been destined to play.

entry.title: MI6's John Sawers says Vladimir Putin's regime poses 'state to state threat'?
entry.summary: Nemtsov was working on a report highlighting Russia's involvement in the separatist revolt in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Russian opposition mourns murdered leader Boris Nemtsov
entry.summary:
Organizers of Sunday's march were divided after Nemtsov's death over whether to hold the rally or turn it into a demonstration of mourning in central Moscow.

Nemtsov was a fighter against corruption.

Nemtsov briefly served as a deputy prime minister under President Boris Yeltsin in the late 1990s, when he gained a reputation as a leading liberal economic reformer.

entry.title: Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov shot dead in Moscow
